required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Efficacy and Safety in Male Subjects With Premature Ejaculation
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Multi-Center Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Two Doses of Tramadol Hydrochloride Orally Disintegrating Tablets in Male Subjects With Premature Ejaculation

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this clinical trial is to test an experimental drug therapy called Tramadol Hydrochloride (HCl) Orally Disintegrating Tablets (ODT) ("Tramadol HCl ODT" or the "study drug"). The patient and the patient's partner are being asked to be in this clinical trial because they have a condition called Premature Ejaculation.

clinical_study.why_stopped: This study was terminated because of recruitment difficulties.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of using Tramadol for Premature Ejaculation

intervention.description: 89 mg or a lesser dose of 62 mg if side effects are experienced one tablet at least two hours before sexual intercourse (maximum of one tablet every 20 hours). Subject will take the study drug for about 27 weeks.

89 mg or a lesser dose of 62 mg if side effects are experienced one tablet at least two hours before sexual intercourse (maximum of one tablet every 20 hours). Subject will take the study drug for about 27 weeks.
